texts.en:
Rebecca, who is married and has two young children, is from Ubay, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store, selling various goods and items to the people in her area.

Rebecca is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise, such as canned goods, candies, chips, snack foods, seasonings, soap and toiletries. This will allow her to improve her stock, thus augmenting her sales and income. Rebecca hopes to make her business a success. She also wants to save money for her children's future schooling.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: James Mark

texts.en: James Mark, who is married and has a 2-year-old son, is from Ubay, Bohol. He has been in the farming business for more than 5 years and it is the source of his income. James Mark is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. This will allow him to improve the productivity of his farm, thus augmenting his yield and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is from the village of Antonino, Alicia, in the Philippines.  She is 51 years old and married to Dominador, who helps her to manage their photography business. She has been in this business for almost 20 years and usually earns a net income of PHP 500 a day. 

The couple wants to give their three children a better quality of life. With regards to her goal in life, Lolita is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy ink, bond paper, laminating pouch film, and photo paper for her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she requested, she will able to earn higher income than the usual income she obtains from her business.

loans.use: to buy ink, bond paper, laminating pouch film, and photo paper for her business

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married and the mother of two young children, living in Ubay, Bohol. 

She earns a living through her hog raising business. She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs. 

She hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

She has been in this business for 14 years. She earns more income from buying and selling dried fish. Amada has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is married. For the past three years, she has run a food vending business in the Philippines. Editha works hard to support her family. 

Editha is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her business. She plans to purchase ingredients such as bananas, sugar, and cooking oil. Editha would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 43, is married and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. Elizabeth aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

For the past ten years, Elizabeth has been running a general store in the Philippines. To earn additional income, she also sells fruit. Elizabeth is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock for her store. Not including this loan, Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her store

loans.name: Olivia Evangelina

texts.es:
Olivia, se dispone a adquirir la materia prima para continuar atendiendo mejor a sus clientes, comprara maíz, frijol, chicharrón, quesillo y gas propano, lo que le facilitara el crecimiento de su negocio.
Con el capital anterior su negocio brindo un mejor servicio, atrajo más clientes, sus ventas son mayores y tiene más ingresos extras.
texts.en:
Olivia is applying for a loan that she will use to buy supplies for her food sales business: maize, beans, chicarron, cheese and propane for her gas cooker.  
She used past loans to improve her service and attract more customers, investments that increased both her revenue and income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food sales business.

loans.name: Rodrigo Salomon

texts.es:
Rodrigo, se decidió por otro préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, plaguicidas, abono y insecticidas, lo que le ayuda a proteger y mejorar sus cosechas de aplatanó, maíz y pipián.
 Con el capital que se le facilito anteriormente el obtuvo una cosecha abundante, y de calidad, mejoro sus ventas, ha recibido ganancias más altas, en su familia todos se encuentran muy saludables.
texts.en:
Rodrigo will use this loan to buy the supplies he needs--manure, fertilizer, insecticide, etc.--to protect and improve his next maize and pipian crop.  
He used past loans to improve both the quantity and quality of his crops, investments that increased his returns and his family's economic situation.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Zviad

texts.en:
Zviad is 42 years old and a married man, who lives with his wife and son. His wife works as a sales lady at a local store and gets a 200 GEL fixed salary. His son is unemployed, for now. The main income of the borrower and his family is a small agricultural activity. Specifically, they have 50 yielding peach trees and 30 cherry trees, and they sell the fruit, in season.

As the family has only seasonal income now, Zviad decided to start trading in fruits and vegetables throughout the year. He sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The Startup Program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor people to get loans for starting or restarting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program, to get a loan of 500 Gel for purchasing products to sell. Zviad has his own car and will transfer products to the capital of Georgia and sell them there. This credit will be a great support for the family, as they will get stable income. Zviad awaits your support.

loans.use: To trade in fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Dimitri

texts.en:
Dimitri is 35 years old, from the Zugdidi district. He is married with two school-age children. Dimitri’s wife works as a salesperson at the local fair market, selling various household items. 

Dimitri’s economic activity is his newly-started store in his district. Specifically, a week ago, he hired the commercial space and purchased merchandise such as dishes and small home appliances for resale. He works as a salesperson himself and hopes his business will be lucrative. In order to expand his store, Dimitri is requesting this loan. With the received amount, he will buy a check machine and add stock to his store.

The business will start normally and become the main source of income for the family. Dimitri hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy a check machine and stock of merchandise for his store

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is grateful for the loan facility advanced to her by Ugafode Microfinance. Her husband being a builder, they realised that if he applied his skills, it would be cheaper to start their own house instead of renting, which was not sustainable given their meagre resources. 

They thought it wise to start a small house with their little savings to be supplemented by a loan. They hope to pay back using the profits from the retail shop as well as the husband's income. Stella is hard working and resilient.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia, 37 years old, lives in Nimba County which shares borders with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire. Because of its status as a border county, trading is the primary activity in the region. It also has the second highest population in Liberia.

Amelia has four children aged between 7 and 18; all of them are presently in school and live at home. Amelia completed 10th grade due to some financial difficulties. For two years, Amelia has been selling red oil in the local market. She has a lot of customers and makes lots of profit every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business. Amelia plans to expand her business and educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 33-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with the packs of laces, zippers, and buttons. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income. 

She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia, age 34, is a married woman. She makes delicious ‘dahi bhallay’, a dish consisting of balls made from ground lentils, deep fried and served in a yogurt sauce. Sofia has worked hard to gain popularity and recognition within her town. She has been successful in consistently making sales and earning a healthy revenue from the business. 

In order to increase her sales, Sofia has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to purchase packs of flour, oil, salt and spices. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. Sofia wishes to spend part of her revenue on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase packs of flour, oil, salt and spices.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 45-year-old married woman; she has been successfully running a business selling animals for many years. She buys animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up, and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation; currently she requests a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more calves. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing better a standard of living to her  family through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Malinche Group

texts.es:
María Emelina: Es una mujer luchadora, jovial, tiene 41 años de edad, es originaria de la Ciudad de Bilwi,  madre soltera de 6 hijos,  de los cuales 5 son adultos y gracias al esfuerzo de su madre son profesionales que ya han formado su familia. El menor, que tiene 20 años, tiene problemas  psicomotores, por lo que no asiste a la escuela, sin embargo su madre lo cuida con esmero y en conjunto con una maestra a domicilio está aprendiendo a leer y escribir.

Hace 10 años estableció su pequeña pulpería, en la cual vende granos básicos, chiverías, sardinas, café y desinfectante. Actualmente solicita financiamiento para comprar nuevos productos: 3 bolsones de meneíto, 3 cajillas de huevo, una docena de pasta de diente, un bolsón de papel higiénico, un bolsón de sopas instantáneas, dos docenas de cloro, una docena de gelatina para el cabello, avena en ristra, una caja de café, un bolsón de pinolillos y galletas. Su sueño es que con el incremento de sus ganancias pueda seguir creciendo su negocio y continuar apoyando a su hijo y nieta que tiene a su cuido.

María Auxiliadora: Vende chiverías, fresco, frutas, enchiladas y gaseosas en la Escuela Normal de Puerto Cabezas y en su vivienda vende frijoles cocidos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería. Su sueño es tener una pulpería en su casa. Maria ha promovido entre sus compañeras conformar el grupo Malinche con el propósito de recibir su primer financiamiento de parte de PANA PANA. 

Francisca: Es una mujer emprendedora, decidió formar parte del grupo con el propósito de iniciar su propio negocio y generar sus propios ingresos, al dedicarse a la venta de carbón, tortillas de maíz, frijoles cocidos y queso en su vivienda. Solicita financiamiento para comprar: 15 libras de  queso, un quintal de maseca, medio quintal de frijoles. Su sueño es tener una pulpería y comprar sus electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking and jovial 41 year old woman.  She is from the city of Bilwi  and it the single mother of six children, 5 of who are fully grown, working as professionals, and have families of their own  thanks to her efforts.  The youngest is 20 years old and has physiological motor problems and is not able to attend school.  However his mother cares for him with great care and she and a teacher are teaching him to read a write.

10 years ago she set up a small store where she sells basic grains, “chiverias,” sardines, coffee, and disinfectant.  She is asking for a loan to buy new products, 3 bags of “meneíto,” 3 cases of eggs, a dozen tubes of toothpaste, a bag of bathroom tissue, a bag of instant soup, two dozen bottles of bleach, a dozen tubes of hair gel, oatmeal, a case of coffee, and a bag of “pinolillos” and cookies.  Her dream is to increase her earnings so she can continue growing her business and continue supporting her son and granddaughter whom she cares for.

María Auxiliadora sells “chiverías,” fresh fruits, enchiladas, and soft drinks in Escuela Normal de Puerto Cabezas and also sells cooked beans from her house.  She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise.  Her dream is to have a store in her house.  Maria and her fellow members joined the Malinche group to get their first loan through PANA PANA. 

Francisca is an enterprising woman and decided to join the group so she could start her own business and generate her own income by selling charcoal, corn tortillas, cooked beans, and cheese out of her home.  She is asking for this loan to buy 15 lbs of cheese, a quintal of “maseca,” and half a quintal of beans.  Her dream is to have a store and be able to buy her appliances.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Ya'qoob

texts.en:
Ya'qoob is 38 years old and lives with his wife and his five children in Ramallah. He works in the drilling works. His dream is to educate his children and give them the best in their life.

Ya'qoob is asking Ryada for this loan to buy wood to install cabinets in the kitchen, and paint it. This will help him to take a step forward because he has a shortage of money to buy the things he needs. 

He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to buy wood to install cabinets in the kitchen, and paint it.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. Delia is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Delia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Delia has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Delia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. Lucia is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Lucia has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia is a 36-year-old woman from the town of Dauis, Bohol. She is married with three children aged fourteen, twelve and eight years old. Her husband works as a laborer to help support their family.

For more than five years now Porferia has run a sari-sari, or variety store, where she sells various items like noodles, chips, sugar, canned goods, soap and shampoo. She is applying for a 7,000 PHP loan to buy extra soft drinks, sacks of rice and other items to meet the demands of her neighborhood customers and her family's daily needs.

Porferia’s aim is to increase her business’s profitability so she can pay for her children’s education as well as become a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy extra stock for her shop.

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat is from Masis town. He lives there with his wife, and together they are involved in a retail business. They rent a small store in the center of the town, and sell clothing. The couple works hard to satisfy the market demand and serve their customers' needs. 

By applying for this loan, Ararat now asks financial support to be able to buy a new stock of clothing to sell in the store. 

The loan will greatly assist Ararat in increasing his turnover, and he hopes for lenders' support.

Ararat has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing for selling in the store

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu lives in Paynesville North area, which has the larger local market in Montserrado. She is married and has two children, aged 3 and 13. Only one is in school, and they all live at home. She described herself as a hardworking woman. 

Since 2010, she has been selling red oil in the communities. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She sells six days a week from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business. 

She plans to build a house. She likes to say thanks to the lenders who are supporting BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos de 59 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en casa propia junto a su hija quien ya es mayor de edad y su nieto. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales (preparación alimenticia a base de masa de maíz, pollo y verduras). El negocio lo tiene en su lugar de residencia y la venta la realiza de forma ambulante.De esta forma ha sacado adelante a su hija y ha llevado el sustento diario. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del piso de la vivienda ya que actualmente es de tierra. Con el crédito comprará cemento, arena y grava.
texts.en: Santos is a 59 year old single mother. She lives in her own home with her adult daughter and her grandson. She makes and sells tamales (made with corn meal, chicken, and vegetables). She runs her business in her neighborhood and travels on foot to make sales. This is how she’s been able to get ahead for her daughter’s sake and meet daily needs. With the ultimate goal of improving living conditions, she’s asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest the redoing the floor in her home which is now a dirt floor. With this loan, she’ll buy cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to build a floor in her home.

loans.name: Carmen María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
Aquí vive la señora Carmen, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de sus hijos viven con ella. Su marido ya no trabaja por motivos de su edad. 
Doña Carmen para salir adelante y en sociedad con una hija instalaron en su casa una tienda de víveres que empezaron con el primer crédito que recibió del banco,  allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hija y ella trabajan allí y ya son 12 años con este negocio el cual les da para vivir honradamente.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 12 años y le gusta porque así empezó su negocio. Su sueño es tener buena salud
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza credit group meets in the Picoaza parish of Portoviejo every two weeks.  This area is known as being a very commercial zone, for its traditional San Pedro festivals, and the happiness of its people.

Carmen lives here.  She is 57 years old, married, and has three adult children, two of whom live with her.  Her husband doesn’t work because of his age.

Carmen and her daughter set up a food store in their home in order to get ahead in society.  They started it with the first loan they got from the communal bank and sell all types of products such as rice, sugar, cooking oils, detergents, beans, vegetables, and fruits.  She works every day from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm and sometimes later.  She and her daughter have been working this business for 12 years and have been making an honest living. 

They will use the money from this loan to expand the business and stock this store with rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, sausages, and other primary needs products.  She has been with the credit group for 12 years and she likes it because she started the business there.  Her dream is to be in good health.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Rosa Estefani

texts.es: Rosa, tiene 21 años, es madre soltera de dos niños de 2 y 5 años. Se dedica a la venta de verduras en un puesto alquilado en el mercado de su localidad. Beneficiaria utilizará el crédito para invertir en la compra de verduras (papas, camotes, cebollas, tomates, limones, zapallo, zanahoria, lechuga y otros) ya que hay bastante afluencia de público y no se abastece con lo que compra. Su sueño es comprarse un puesto en el mercado y comprarse una casa.
texts.en: Rosa is 21 years old and the single mother of two children, ages 2 and 5.  She sells vegetables in a rented stall at the local market.  She will use the money from this loan to buy vegetables (potatoes, tomatoes, lemons, pumpkin, carrots, lettuce, and other things).  There is a big customer demand and what she has is not enough.  Her dream is to buy a market stall and a house.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: Isabel, tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, vive con su hijo de 3 años en casa familiar, desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a su familia con los gastos, ha trabajado en varias instituciones privadas de su ciudad, actualmente labora en una empresa de seguros como asesora de ventas, paralelamente estudia  Administración de empresas en la Universidad. Beneficiaria utilizará el dinero para costear tratamiento médico de su hijo. Su sueño es terminar su carrera profesional para buscar un trabajo de tiempo completo el cual le permita comprase su casa y mejor la calidad de vida de su hijo y familia
texts.en: Isabel is 32 years old, married, and lives with her three year old son at a relative’s house.  She had to start working when she was very young so she could help with the family expenses.  She has worked in several private institutions in town and currently works for an insurance company as a sales advisor and is also studying management at the university.  She will use the money from this loan to pay for medical expenses for her son.  Her dream is to finish her education so she can look for a full time job that will allow her to buy a house and improve her and her son’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses for her son.

loans.name: Dario

texts.en: Dario, who is married and has seven grown-up children, is from Ubay, Bohol. He earns a living through his retail business, selling various goods and items to the people in his area. Dario is asking for a loan to buy additional stock, such as canned goods, noodles, candies, biscuits, chips, snack foods, beverages, soap and toiletries. This will allow him to improve the variety of his stock, thus augmenting his sales and income.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in his store

loans.name: Zinabu

texts.en:
Zenabu is a junior high school graduate. She specializes in preparing and selling "Ga Kenkey" (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in corn leaves), served with red / black pepper sauce, and fried fish. She usually sells her "Kenkey" at Abura, Cape Coast. She has been involved in preparing and selling "Kenkey" for some years.

Zenabu is married and has one child. Her husband is a trader. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their child’s school fees. 

She wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty "Kenkey." In the long term, Zenabu plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Cicik

texts.en:
Cicik is a 44-year-old woman who is married to I Wayan Sutama, a 48-year-old entrepreneur. They have been blessed with 3 children: Santana, 10, and Nandi, 7, are elementary school students and Galuh, 5, attends kindergarten. 

Cicik and her husband run a driving instructor business, which they initiated using their own capital. Cicik manages administrative matters while her husband provides the driving lessons. Their car presently requires maintenance but, unfortunately, they do not have enough money to do so. Cicik has requested a loan of IDR 4,500,000 to be spent on car maintenance.

loans.use: to pay car maintenance expenses

loans.name: Melbin Rodolfo

texts.es:
Melvin tiene 37 años de edad, estado civil Unión Libre vive con su esposa y con sus hijos de 10, 6 años, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos
La ventanilla se llama SAN NICOLAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, perteneciente a la parroquia Ricaurte cantón Urdaneta, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Melvin se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en Cantón Urdaneta.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es darles el estudio a sus hijos y mejorar en los negocios
Le gusta trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Melvin, 37, lives with his wife and two children, 10- and 6-years old, respectively.  They live in Ventanas, a district of Los Rios province.
The SAN NICOLAS community bank is located in San Nicolas, a rural area in the district of Urdaneta.  The members of the bank make their livings from farming and livestock businesses.
Melvin has made his living growing maize and rice for several years now.  He buys what he needs in Ventanas and sells what he grows there and in Urdaneta district.  
Melvin is applying for a new loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs to plant his next maize and rice crop.  Past loans have helped him to increase his income and better care for his family.  For the future, he wants to grow his business and ensure that his children get good educations.
Working his fields is something he enjoys, he says.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Honorine's Group

texts.fr: C'est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Honorine (dont le doigt est levé sur la photo), est âgée de 49 ans. Honorine est mariée à un certain Louis. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Honorine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins du ménage. Honorine a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour se prendre en charge et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Honorine prépare de la nourriture (riz, etc.) qu'elle vend à son domicile depuis une vingtaine d'année. Honorine achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Honorine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui permettra certainement à Honorine et à son groupe d’accroître leur stock de produits et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
This is a group of three people, the members of which live in the same neighborhood. The group leader is Honorine (whose finger is raised in the photo), who is 49 years old. Honorine is married to a man by the name of Louis. The couple has four children, some of whom attend school and all of whom are in their care. Honorine lives with her children and her husband. The couple provides for the various needs of the household.

Honorine attended very little school. In order to take care of herself and to see to the needs of her children, Honorine has been cooking food (rice, etc.) that she sells from her home for some 20 years. She purchases her supplies in a market in Benin. This is the second time that Honorine has solicited a loan from ALIDé, which will without doubt allow Honorine and her group to expand their stock of supplies and to better respond to customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase food and condiments.

loans.name: Cristina Sternao

texts.es:
Cristina, está preparando su negocio para estas épocas de fin de año en las que las ventas aumentan, necesita capital para comprar blusas, faldas, camisas, pantalones y ropa para niños y niña, en variedad de estilos, colores y tallas.
El efecto que le dio el préstamo anterior fue muy positivo ya que ofrecía más productos a sus clientes, sus ventas aumentaron y su economía ha mejorado. Sigue trabajando para lograr tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Cristina will use this loan to stock her clothing sales business.  She wants to restock now because sales typically increase at the end of the year and she needs clothing--blouses, skirts, pants, etc.--of various kinds and sizes.
She used past investments to stock her business with a wider range of merchandise, thereby increasing her sales and improving her economic situation.  For the future, she will continue working and saving for a house of her own.

loans.use: to restock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 24 años de edad, estado civil Unión Libre vive con la esposa y con su hijo de 3 meses, Vive en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama SAN NICOLAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, perteneciente a la parroquia Ricaurte cantón Urdaneta, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Víctor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en Agroquímica Carlita y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es salir adelante con su familia.
Le gusta ser responsable en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Víctor is 24 years old and in a common law marriage. He lives with his wife and their 3 month old child. He lives in the province Canton Ventanas de los Rios. The state is called San Nicholas which is located in Recinto San Nicholas, in the Ricaurte parish and the Urdaneta canton. People in this state work on farms or in fisheries. Victor has working as a famer for a few years, growing corn and rice. He buys supplies in Ventanas from Agroquimica Carlita and sells them in the market there. 

He’s asking for a loan to buy manure and fertilizers for his corn and rice crop. This loan will help him increase income that he uses for family expenses and investment. He dream is to get his family ahead.  He likes being a responsible worker.

loans.use: to plant corn and rice.

loans.name: Gertrudis De Jesus

texts.es:
Gertrudis, opta por otro crédito para completar la siembra de maicillo y terminar la cosecha de tabaco,frijol y maíz, invertirá en la compra de abono y pago de mano de obra, para el tratamiento de sus diferentes cultivos y le garantiza una buena cosecha.
Con el crédito anterior Gertrudis pudo comprar los insumos necesarios para preparar el terreno donde cultiva, mejoro su producción, ha aumentado su área de cultivo, sus ingresos han mejorado y ha podido cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Gertrudis has opted for another loan to finish planting millet and harvesting tobacco, beans, and corn. She will invest in labor costs and paying for manure to treat her different crops and guarantee a good harvest. 

With the last loan Gertrudis was able to buy supplies she needed to prepare the land for cultivation and improve her production. She increased the size of her crops, her income grew, and she was able to pay off her debts.

loans.use: to buy manure and pay for labor.

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Luz, a sus 47 años de edad, es una mujer activa y trabajadora, dedicada a su familia y a su labor; vive con su esposo y su única hija de 12 años de edad a la que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Durante su vida productiva, trabajó como empleada en una legumbrería, pero debido a un desalojo del espacio en el que estaba ubicado el establecimiento, ella optó por iniciar el negocio por cuenta propia, para aprovechar todo el conocimiento y la experiencia que tenía en la labor; trabaja sola todos los días de 7:00 am a 5:30 pm para aprovechar al máximo el flujo de personas que transitan por el lugar; así ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar, durante los 24 años que lleva funcionando su establecimiento.
Actualmente solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en el arreglo de las estanterías (pintura) y comprar surtido al por mayor (frutas y verduras), esto le permitirá dar una mejor imagen al negocio y podrá atraer nuevos clientes, además tendrá más variedad de productos para ofrecer y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Luz manifiesta su interés en hacer crecer su negocio, fortalecerlo para que siga perdurando en el tiempo y pueda ser más rentable para que le garantice una estabilidad económica que le de la capacidad para ofrecer una mejor educación y formación en valores a su hija; así podrá tener un mejor futuro y bienestar.
texts.en:
Luz, at 47 years old, is an active and hard working woman, dedicated to her family and her work. She lives with her husband and their only daughter who is 12. They have helped her get ahead with a lot of effort. During her productive life, Luz worked as an employee at a greengrocers, but due to the eviction of the space where the shop was located, she decided to start a business for herself and take advantage of all the knowledge and experience she had gained working in the business. She works on her own from 7 am to 5.30 pm to catch the flow of people passing through the area. Like this she has managed to earn enough income to contribute to the family"s finances over the 24 years that she has run the business.

She is currently asking for a loan so that she can invest in repairing the shelves (paint) and buy produce in bulk (fruits and vegetables). This will allow her to present a better image of the business and attract new customers. She will also have a wider variety of products on offer to satisfy the needs of her customers. Luz also wants to expand her business, and strengthen it so that it will last and maybe become more profitable. This would guarantee a economic stability that would allow her to offer a better education and training in values to her daughter so she will have a better future and well-being.

loans.use: repair shop shelves and buy produce in bulk.

loans.name: Otar

texts.en:
Otar lives in Kutaisi city. He is 29 years old, single, and lives with his parents and brother. The only breadwinner in the household is Otar’s brother, who is employed at a private company as a distributor. His wage is nearly $235 per month. Otar is jobless at the moment, and he wishes to start a new business for generating income.

His loan request was approved, in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up Loan Program envisages the provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions, to country vulnerable poor people. These individuals do not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of their low income. With the received credit, Otar will purchase a car and serve the local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase, and Otar will be able to improve the living conditions of the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is from Persati, a village located in western Georgia. He is thirty-two years old and married. Vazha lives with his parents, sister, retired grandmother, wife, and two toddlers. 

To earn a living, Vazha operates a distribution business. Specifically, he buys various fertilizers and animal feed in bulk at the capital city market and distributes the products in his district and neighboring towns. Although Vazha works hard, his earnings are still modest and hardly enough to cover the expenses of his large family.

In order to generate more funds, Vazha plans to open a store in his district that sells fertilizers and animal feed. He has already rented a commercial space and installed the shelves. Vazha's plan is to both operate a store and continue distribution.

This business initiative will increase the family's income and allow them to improve their standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to start a store that sells fertilizers and animal feed

loans.name: Ervin Leonel

texts.es: Don Ervin tiene 48 años de edad, casado y padre de dos hijos. Originario  de la ciudad de Estelí. Trabaja como guarda de seguridad, el cual le ha permitido generarle ingresos a su familia. Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Solicita el crédito para mejorar el saneamiento de su vivienda con el fin de garantizar una red sanitaria segura e higiénica a su hogar. Estima que el crédito le ayudara ya que podrá cumplir su meta de tener una mejor calidad de vida. Su plan futuro es acondicionar la vivienda.
texts.en: Ervin is 48 years old, married, and the father of two children. He’s originally from the city of Esteli. He works as a security guard which allows him to earn money for his family. His goal is to improve his living conditions. He’s asking for a loan to improve his home’s sanitation system and make it safe and hygienic. He believes the loan will be helpful since he’ll be able to have a better quality of life. In the future he plans to get air conditioning.

loans.use: to improve the sanitation system in his home.

loans.name: Felix Astul

texts.es:
Félix, es soltero, vive junto a su hermano, anteriormente era maestro, luego apoyaba a su hermana en su  negocio, pero desde hace ocho años se independizo y fundó su propio negocio en el que vende calzado y artículos para el hogar, en todo este tiempo no le representa ningún problema atenderlo.
Invertirá en la compra de variedad de calzado y artículos para el hogar, con lo que tendrá variedad de ofertas con las que podar cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Espera aumentar sus venta, tener más clientes y recibir ingresos extras con los que puede mejorar su calidad de vida.
Aspira tener un negocio más competitivo en su propio local para tener comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
Félix is single and lives with his brother. He used to be a teacher and then he helped his brother with his business. For the past 8 years he’s been self-employed and running his own business in which he sells shoes and home goods. Right now he’s not experiencing any problems running his business. 

He will invest in the purchase of shoes and home goods so that he’ll have a variety of items to meet his customers’ needs.  He hopes to increase his sales, have more clients, and earn more so that he can improve his quality of life. 

He wants to have a more competitive business and his own shop to be able to buy his own home.

loans.use: to buy a variety of shoes and home goods.

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María, es casada vive con sus dos hijos, es empleada y también tiene un negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada, con el que genera ingresos extras para cubrir los gastos de su familia. Se negocio de venta de ropa lo aprendió de algunas conocidas, ya tiene 6 meses de tenerlo.
Comprara más fardos de ropa usada y ropa nueva, con lo que surtirá su negocio para la temporada navideña, espera tener más clientes, aumentar sus ventas y tener una economía más estable.
Sueña con ampliar su negocio, dar una mejor vida a su familia y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
María is married and lives with her two children. She works as a maid and also has a business selling new and used clothing. The extra income from the business pays for the family expenses. She’s had the business for six months and she learned how to sell clothing from some acquaintances.

With the loan money María plans to buy more bundles of used and new clothing so she has lots of stock for the Christmas season. She is hoping for more customers, increased sales, and a more stable income. Her dreams are to expand the business, provide a better life for her family, and make improvements to her house.

loans.use: buy more bundles of used and new clothing

loans.name: Francis Remberto

texts.es:
Francis, vive junto a su familia la cual está compuesta por su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos. Para generar los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, se dedica a vender minutas y limonadas, lo aprendió de su padre, ya tiene 10 años de hacerlo de manera independiente.
El capital lo invertirá en la compra de 2 coches así como también ingredientes para las minutas como jaleas, limones, hielo, entre otros, espera mejorar la atención a sus clientes, aumentar su producción y generar los ingresos que necesita para cumplir con sus compromisos.
Sueña con ampliar su negocio para poder reparar su vivienda y darles a su familia una mejor alimentación, educación y vestuarios.
texts.en:
Francis lives with his family which is made up of his wife and their two children. To cover his household expenses, he earns his living selling snacks and lemonade, a job he learned from his father. Francis has been doing this work by himself for ten years.

He is planning to use the loan money to buy two carts as well as ingredients for the snacks such as jello, lemons, ice etc. He hopes to improve customer service, increase production, and earn the extra income he needs to cover his commitments. Francis’s dreams are to expand his business, be able to repair his house, and provide his family with better food, education, and clothing.

loans.use: buy two carts

loans.name: Jerusalem Group

texts.en:
Sekai, the group leader for Jerusalem Group, has operated a peanut butter making business for the past three years. She operates from home and supplies individuals and shop owners. Some of Sekai's clients buy on credit and other cash bases. She has applied for her loan of $400 to buy groundnuts for making peanut butter. 

The other group members have cross-border businesses.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts to manufacture peanut butter.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old and lives in Tappita City of Nimba County. She did not go to school. She has seven children between 7 and 23 years old. They are in school and live with her at home. For 15 years now she has been selling sugar, flour, oil, vita, etc. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more sugar, flour, oil, Vita (juice drink), etc., for the business. She sells for six days,  spending ten hours each day at her business. She described her herself as a businesswoman.

Low income is the problem she is facing in her business. She started this business with money from her garden sales. She learned this business from her mother. She likes her business because of the ways people respond to her business. Her plans is to educate her children, and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, flour, oil, Vita (juice drink), etc., for the business.

loans.name: Simukai Group

texts.en: Mavis, the chairperson of this group, has a cross-border business. She goes to South Africa to buy clothes for resale in Zimbabwe-Mutare. Mavis does the same business as her other group members. They have been doing this business ever since they came for their 1st loan and now they have applied for a third loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale to meet the high demand.

loans.name: Keynne Salvador

texts.fr:
Mr KEYNNE SALVADOR est un étudiant en classe de Master II à l’ESTPO. Il est célibataire sans enfant.
Il est à l’ESTPO depuis 03ans.
Mr veut financer ses études supérieures à l’ESTPO.
Il ambitionne obtenir son diplôme d’ingénieur de conception en génie civil pour servir sa nation et se marier.
texts.en:
Mr. Keynne Salvador is a Master II [second-year master's degree] student at ESTPO [l'Ecole supérieur des travaux publics de Ouagadougou, an Ouagadougou university for public works/civil engineering studies]. He is single and has no children. He has been at ESTPO for three years.

Mr. Keynne Salvador wants to fund his graduate studies at ESTPO. His goal is to obtain his degree as a design engineer in civil engineering in order to serve his country and to marry.

loans.use: To pay for his graduate studies at ESTPO [a civil engineering university].

loans.name: Hippolyte

texts.en:
Hyppolyte is a young Cameroonian, aged thirty two, and married with a child who is a year old. He has been in this business for year now which makes him experience and stable.

His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase his turn over by fifty percent. His standard of living will as well be improved

loans.use: to buy planks for the fabrication of chairs, cupboards, and tables

loans.name: Colinas Group

texts.es:
Jacinta: Es una mujer amable, emprendedora. Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 42 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos, todos asisten al colegio. Desde hace dos años estableció su pulpería en su vivienda con sus ahorros y apoyo económico de su esposo; comenzó con medio quintal de arroz y azúcar, 25 libras de harina y una docena de papel higiénico. Solicita financiamiento para comprar más mercadería para que su negocio vaya creciendo y pueda generar más ingresos. Desea comprar: Un quintal de arroz, azúcar, 50 libras de harina, dos docenas de cloro y dos cajillas de huevo. Su sueño es construir en el terreno de su vivienda, casitas de tambo para alquilarlas a precios accesibles y tener otra fuente de ingreso y que también el negocio de la pulpería se vaya diversificando al vender productos de belleza y accesorios para hombres y mujeres y apoyar a su hija menor, particularmente en su salud, debido a que recientemente le diagnosticaron anemia y problemas del corazón, por lo que también necesita viajar a Managua para que la valoren los médicos especializados.

Lesbia: Vende productos de belleza por catálogo y es piquinera (mujeres que les pagan por adelantados a los buzos de langostas para que les provean de los recursos del mar), es la coordinadora del grupo Colinas que conformó desde Junio 2012. Su sueño es contar con un local para su negocio en punto estratégico de la Ciudad de Bilwi, para tener más clientes y vender más.

Katrina: Desde hace 4 años vende productos de belleza y de cosméticos por catálogo, también vende de manera ambulante Yuca, quequisque, malanga, banano, filipitas y plátano. Su sueño es tener un tramo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Jacinta is a friendly, enterprising woman.  She is from Puerto Cabazas, is 42 years old and has four children; all attend school.  She has had a store in her home for two years and is able to help her husband financially with her earnings.  She started with half a quintal of rice and sugar, 25 lbs of flour and a dozen rolls of bathroom tissue.  She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise so that her business will grow and she can earn more of an income.  She wants to buy a quintal of rice, 50 lbs of flour, 2 dozen bottles of bleach, and two cases of eggs.  Her dreams are to build some small houses on her land so she can rent them out at affordable prices and have another source of income, and also that her store diversifies and she begins selling beauty products and men’s and women’s accessories, and to support her daughter, particularly in health.  She was recently diagnosed with anemia and heart trouble, so she needs to travel to Managua so that the specialists can evaluate her.

Lesbia sells beauty products via catalog and is also a lobster broker (women who pay lobster divers in advance to that they provide them the bounty of the sea).  She is also the Colinas group’s coordinator, which formed in June 2012.  Her dream is to have a location of her own, in a strategic part of the city of Bilwi, for her business, so that she can have more customers and sell more.

Katrina: Desde hace 4 años vende productos de belleza y de cosméticos por catálogo, también vende de manera ambulante Yuca, quequisque, malanga, banano, filipitas y plátano. Su sueño es tener un tramo en el mercado.

Katrina has been selling beauty products and cosmetics via catalog for four years.  She also sells yucca, taro, banana, filipitas, and plantains.  Her dream is to have a stall in the market.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Jay Hanuman Self Help Group

texts.en:
Jay Hanuman Self Help Group is a group consisting of 11 members, all of whom are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. 

A few years back, they all were facing the same kind of situation of poverty, so they planned to start grocery shops where they can provide the basic household consumables to their customers. One of them is Kanak, who was selected as their president. 

Kanak is a 39-year-old lady living with her husband and her one son who is at his schooling. The lady in the picture standing third from the right in the front row is Kanak. Her husband works as a laborer in a factory situated near to her village. She runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. 

She has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers, for which she has requested a loan to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables.

loans.use: to purchase some grocery items for her grocery shop like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables in bulk.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is 41 years old and a married woman. She has been doing business, selling milk, for a period of about seven years. She does this work together with her husband. She has four cows in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis, to generate an extra amount of income. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life.

She is happily running her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Recently, she requested a loan of PKR 45,000, which she will use to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen, age 52, is a widow who works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for four years and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Parveen was not earning an income, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Being a single parent, she felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele.  

Parveen has now requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more raw materials such as spools of thread, packs of laces, ribbons and buttons in various colors. These purchases will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time. Parveen expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials such as threads, laces, ribbons and buttons

loans.name: Kashwer

texts.en:
Kashwer is 51 year old and married.  She has been doing business manufacturing carpets for the past 10 years. 

She offers various handmade carpets, and she has become famous in providing good quality products in her circle. 

She is happily doing it for the sake of her family. She is the mother of six children and is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, and clothing.  It’s her eighth year with the Kashf Foundation, and she is satisfied with the support it gives her. 

Currently she has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. 

She expects boost in her net income and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Sana'

texts.en:
Sana' is 24 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in Balata, a Palestinian refugee camp. In 1950 Balata was established in the northern area of the West Bank near the city of Nablus. It is the largest refugee camp in the West Bank.

Sana’ is applying for a 1,500 USD loan through Ryada to install windows in her house and pay for work on the bathroom plumbing to stop water from leaking into the room. This will help her to improve her house and make it better. She is very grateful to everyone who decides to help her.

loans.use: to install windows in her house and pay for plumbing work on the bathroom.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is 25 years old. She is married with two children ages three and seven. The latter is in school.

Since last year Yvonne has been selling fruit. She is applying for a 600,000 RWF loan through Urwego not only to buy more fruit but be able to sell beans and sorghum.

Yvonne plans to reinvest the profits in her business.

loans.use: To buy fruit, beans and sorghum to sell

loans.name: Kious Group

texts.en:
Yayah is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Yayah was born in Sandor, in eastern Sierra Leone, 38 years ago. He is married to a businesswoman, and the couple has four children. Three of them are attending primary school, and one is in secondary school.

Yayah sells food at a market: tomatoes, etcetera. He has been a businessman for many years, now. With the help of this loan, he and his fellow group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently, improve on their standard of living. Yayah will use his share of the loan to buy tomatoes, etcetera, in large quantity, to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, etcetera, in large quantity

loans.name: Oussama

texts.en:
Oussama is a 26-year-old single Palestinian refugee who spent almost all of his life living and working in a Palestinian camp just like almost all of the Palestinians living in Lebanon with limited access to several living and working domains. Oussama has thirteen years of experience in his current domain, since he had to quit school and work hard to support his parents in their living. Oussama has a small fuel station inside the camp where he provides the citizens with the fuel and diesel which they request a lot during the winter season since they depend on it for getting warm.

Thus, Oussama is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmou, to increase his business merchandise with big quantities of diesel which is highly requested during this season by the customers to warm up since they face a very cold winter season in his region. This will be Oussama's sixth cycle as Al Majmoua borrower. Through his previous loans, he established a car wash section which he is also working hard to develop properly. Oussama hopes to develop his station and become capable of opening another branch outside the camp which will sure increase his income and enhance his living.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with big quantities of diesel which is highly requested during this season by the customers to warm up since they face a very cold winter season in his region.

loans.name: Kenia Guadalupe

texts.es: Kenia tiene la edad de 24 años, su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y usada desde hace 2 años  tiempo en el cual ha demostrado ser una persona muy trabajadora y  luchadora, casada, con dos hijos menores, ella comercializa la mercadería en su comunidad y alrededores. Solicita un crédito para la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisas, ropa niños, shores, ropa usada escogidas como pantalones y camisas de diferentes tamaños y estilos
texts.en:
Kenia is 24 years old and she has sold new and used clothing for 2 years. During this time she has shown herself to be very hard-working and tough. She is married, with children and she markets her merchandise in her community and the surrounding areas. 

She is asking for a loan to buy pants, blouses, shirts, children's clothing, shorts and to purchase certain used articles of clothing such as pants and shirts of different sizes and styles.

loans.use: to buy a variety of new clothing and certain used articles of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Meet Beatrice, a well-established farmer in Nyamira, a popular banana-growing area. She is married and has four children. She has practiced farming for the past 22 years, producing and selling milk, eggs, and a few horticultural crops. She also has a retail shop, which serves as an extra source of income.

Beatrice chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, because their loan requirements are favorable. During the training she learned how to develop a lifestyle of savings, and also proper loan repayment procedure. This loan will help her to generate more income that will help her take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a petty trader who sells crates of eggs at Abura, located in Cape Coast. She sells to individuals and also supplies it to others for resale. She left middle-school at form four level, but this has not stopped her from making it in life. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a carpenter. She has been selling eggs for some years. Her income is used to support her husband to pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase increased amounts of eggs thus allowing her to meet customers’ rising demand. Beatrice hopes to use the profits from her sales to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive quality education.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of eggs thus allowing her to meet customers' rising demand.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth has had some form of formal education since she is a senior high school graduate. Elizabeth sells phones and and phone accessories in a shop at Abura, Cape Coast. She buys phones from wholesalers to resell to individuals. She has been involved in this business for quite some time. Elizabeth is married with three children. The income from her business is used in helping her husband (who is also a petty trader) to pay her children’s school fees. She has noticed that there are growing demands among consumers for phones and accessories. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited working capital. She thus aims to use her loan to purchase more phones and accessories for sale to increase her inventory levels. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth wants to ensure that all her children will be given the opportunity to education.

loans.use: to purchase more phones and accessories for sale to increase her inventory levels.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: Nasiba is an industrious woman. She is 20 years old and is married but has no children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Three years ago she began her own business of sewing national dresses for women. She has her own workshop in the centre of her town. Thanks to her good service, she has managed to gain many customers. Since she has opened her business, her family’s quality of life has been improving. She wants to develop her business further but she needs to buy new sewing machine and fabric. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy a sewing machine and fabric. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Marcia Azucena

texts.es: Marcia es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, soltera y sin hijos a cargo. Tiene 33 años de edad. Es una mujer de oficio  psicóloga, se dedica a la gerencia (coordinadora) de proyectos. activida que ha desempeñado desde hace 10 años, permitiéndole salir adelante pos si sola. Su meta próxima es cancelar el crédito y seguir mejorando su hogar. Solicita el crédito para mejorar el saneamiento de su vivienda, con el fin de tener una red sanitaria segura. Estima que el crédito le permitirá cumplir con su meta y tener un hogar con las mejores condiciones de vida. Su plan futuro es darle mantenimiento constante al sistema de red sanitaria.
texts.en: Marcia is a native of the city of Estili. She is single and has no children in her care. She is 33 years old. She is by profession a psychologist. She works in project management (coordinator), a job she has worked in for 10 years, allowing her to advance on her own. Her next goal is to pay off her loan and continue improving her home. She is applying for the loan to improve the sanitation system of her home, with the goal of having a reliable sanitation system. She feels that the loan will allow her to achieve her goal and have a home with the best living conditions. Her future plan is to give regular maintenance to the sanitation system.

loans.use: to improve the sanitation system of her home.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 32 years old and lives in Tappita City, in Nimba County. She is unmarried and has three children, between 2 and 11 years old. They all live at home and currently are in school. For 15 years now, Edith has been involved with sales of pepper, bitter ball, and similar items. She makes lots of profit and has more customers. She sells for six days per week, spending 12 hours each day at her business. She described her herself as a serious woman.

She is requesting a loan to purchase pepper, bitter ball, etcetera, for her business. She hopes to see her children receive quality education.

loans.use: to purchase pepper, bitter ball, etcetera, for her business.

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero is 26 years old. She works and lives in Tappita. She is an 11th grade dropout; is unmarried and has three children between the ages of 11 months and 6 years old. Only two of her children are in school, and all of them live at home. For four years now she has been selling red oil, rice, pepper, etc. She sells for six days spending 8 hours each day at her business. A problem she facing is less goods on hand. She describes her herself as businesswoman. She is a requesting a loan to purchase red oil, rice, pepper, etc. for her business. She started this business with money received from her mother, and learned this way of selling from friends. She enjoys the flows of customers. Her plans are to expand her business, and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase red oil, rice, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Hasmanny

texts.es:
Hasmanny vive en casa de sus abuelos, trabaja como conductor asalariado perteneciente al servicio público, su vivienda esta ubicada en la zona Ernesto Torrez de la cuidad de La Paz.

Su trabajo actual le permite sobrevivir día a día, cubriendo los gastos básicos dentro de su casa. 

El sueño de HASMANNY poder generar mayores ingresos para ayudar a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida, por este motivo desea invertir el dinero en la compra de una acción en una de las  minas del departamento de La Paz junto a sus padres, de tal manera que tenga ingresos extras y así poder mejorar como familia. 

Es la segunda vez con IMPRO  y la segunda con KIVA, que tiene los créditos, y está muy satisfecho con el mismo.
texts.en:
Hasmanny lives in his grandparents' house and works as a salaried bus driver for the municipality. His home is located in the "Ernesto Torrez" district of the city of La Paz. His current job allows him to survive day by day, allowing him to cover the basic household expenses.

Hasmanny's dream is to be able to increase his earnings so that he can help his family and improve their quality of life. For this reason he wants to invest money by purchasing a share of one of the mines in the state of La Paz, along with his parents. This will give him additional earnings, thus being able to improve the family.

This is his second loan with IMPRO and second loan with Kiva. He is very satisfied with the loans.

loans.use: to buy a share of one of the local mines.

loans.name: Rosa Esperanza

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Estancia Vieja. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad, la menor aún viven con ellos. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Rosa con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo a llevar la dura carga de mantener el hogar realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice para su trabajo, su esposo en la época invernal siembra maíz y maní, el necesita del crédito para pagar la mano de obra para poder sembrar sus cultivos. Ella por su parte tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa, allí vende bebidas como gaseosas,  aguas, sodas y cervezas, esto le dejas ganancias las cuales les permiten salir adelante hasta que las cosechas empiecen a rendir sus frutos.
Este crédito es para pagar mano de obra para las siembras y para comprar gaseosas, aguas y cervezas. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan  los créditos. Su sueño es tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
In the area known as Estancia Vieja in the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo, every fifteen days the members of Grupo De Crédito Estancia Vieja meet. It is a place of humble people that work in agriculture and general trade. 

In this place lives Rosa who is 55. She is married and has five adult children; the youngest still lives with her and her husband. Her husband works in agriculture. Rosa with the hopes of helping her husband carry the heavy burden of supporting the household asks for this loan so that he can use it for his job.

In the winter season her husband plants corn and peanuts. He needs the loan to pay for the labor needed to plant their crops. Rosa in turn has a small business in their house where she sells drinks such as sodas, waters, soda water and beers. This business leaves them with profits which allows them to move forward until the crops begin to bear their fruits. 

This loan is to pay for the labor for planting and to buy sodas, waters and beers. She has been with Grupo De Crédito since the beginning and she likes it for the help that they provide with their loans. Her dream is to have her own grocery store.

loans.use: to pay for labor and buy sodas, waters and beers.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman who has been blessed with seven children, one underage, four in school and two adults. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Nyamvula operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting for a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Fabienne

texts.en:
Fabienne is 30 years old. She sells shoes and has been in the business for the past two years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more types of shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is forty years old and lives in Paynesville North, which has the largest local market in Montserrado. She is a widow and has five children, two of whom are in school and live at home. She describes herself as family-oriented.

Since 1997 Oretha has been selling iron soap, a local soap made from palm oil and caustic. She started her business with money from her susu account (a susu collector offers a customer an informal and local way to secure one’s money). She works from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. and makes a good profit. She uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her market spot.

Oretha is applying for a 20,000 LRD loan through BRAC Liberia to buy more palm oil and caustic for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She wants to say thank you to lenders who support her.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil and caustic for her business.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 50-year-old married woman. She has a business selling fancy clothes to the people of her community. She buys a variety of clothes in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Zahida is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide collection of clothes in different sizes and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide collection of clothes in different sizes and designs.

loans.name: Merita

texts.en:
Merita wants to plant onion seeds soon; the season to do that is approaching and she does not want to miss this opportunity. Her region is known for the quality and quantity of red onions. Almost every household in the southeastern part of the country produces over 300 kg/year of this vegetable of the genus allium. Some years they sell all the produce to local whole buyers/sellers but sometimes not, and this is what frustrates villagers according to Merita. 

“We put so much physical work and invest money at it throughout the process and the end results come to zero sometimes. We are still waiting for the newest government to come up with a solution to this issue. Let’s see because they promised us a lot during their campaign,” Merita ended her conversation with the loan officer.

Merita is 40 and has two children.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds to plant.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is 21 years old and is a married woman. She has been in a beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to deal with more customers day by day. For this she requires hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities, so she applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 through Kashf Foundation.  

She is in her 5th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Diana Aracely

texts.es:
Diana Aracely tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte en una zona rural.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, cerdos desde hace más de 15 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra cerdos y alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Diana Aracey is 39 years old. She lives with her two children in the district of Oyotún. Oyotún is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo in a rural area on the north coast and its population is engaged in agriculture, trade and animal breeding.

Diana Aracey has been breeding and selling animals, such as ducks, roosters, hens, chickens, and pigs for more than 15 years. Her business is located at her home. She has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase pigs and fodder to fatten them. By this she will generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for the fattening of small livestock.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRIMAVERA”  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, tejido de mantas, venta de muebles, venta de insecticidas, venta de ropa, servicio de construcción, venta de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de compra y venta de muebles; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de su esposo quien trabaja el mismo negocio, con el pasar del tiempo y un pequeño capital decide emprender un negocio independiente para generar mayor economía.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de muebles) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, las capacitaciones y el crédito accesible que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The nine members of the PRIMAVERA community bank will join the Alto Lima Center for a fifth round of funding with Pro Mujer.  Julia is the group's president.  Members have a various businesses that include: produce sales; textile production; furniture sales; insecticide sales; clothing sales; construction services; and textile sales.

Julia's furniture business is one of the microbusinesses that will benefit from the loan.  Julia joined the group a year ago after a friend who was already a member invited her to join too.  Julia says that she learned to buy and sell furniture from her husband who has a similar business.  She built up savings of her own and started a separate furniture sales business.

Julia will use this loan to stock her furniture business.  She will buy merchandise from furniture wholesalers in La Paz and resell her inventory locally.  The business generates an income that helps to support her family, including her two children.

When we asked Julia what she most likes about Pro Mujer, she told us that she likes the training she's received and the access she has to affordable credit.

loans.use: to buy furniture for resale.

loans.name: Jose Rudy

texts.es:
José, vive con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos, para cubrir los gastos familiares de su hogar se dedica a cultivar maíz y pipián, es una actividad que desempeña desde hace 15 años lo aprendió de su familia, trabaja de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 2:00 p.m., por su experiencia es una actividad que no le representa algún problema.
Invertirá en la compra de abono, pesticida, plaguicida y fertilizante, espera que su cosecha sea abundante, mejorar sus ventas y obtener los ingresos que tanto necesita para cumplir con sus obligaciones familiares.
Sueña con ampliar el área de cultivo, seguir teniendo los recursos para cancelar sus deudas y dar a su familia lo necesario para que puedan vivir mejor.
texts.en:
José lives with his life companion and their three children. To cover the household expenses of his family, he grows corn and squash. He has been doing this work for 15 years. He learned it from his family. He works from 6:00 am to 2:00 pm. In his experience, this is work that does not pose any problems.

He will invest [the loan] in the purchase of compost, pesticides, and fertilizer. He hopes that his harvest will be abundant and that he will improve his sales and obtain the income that he needs so much to fulfill his family obligations.

He dreams of expanding the area that he cultivates, continuing to have the resources to pay off his debts, and giving his family what is needed so that they can live better.

loans.use: to buy compost, pesticides, and fertilizer

loans.name: Mutaz

texts.en:
Mutaz is 23 years old; his life conditions prevented him from completing his higher education. 

Mutaz was working as a taxi driver; a year ago, he opened an office to provide transportation services. He has a group of drivers and he is the manager. He asked Ryada for this youth loan to purchase a car tracking device, so that he can monitor the work that is being done.

Mutaz has a lot of customers who prefer to use his taxi service since he drives attentively and very carefully so he has good customers. He hops that this business will result in an increase in his income and enable him to give his children good living conditions and be able to meet their needs.

loans.use: to purchase a car tracking device so he can monitor the work that is being done.

loans.name: Gulbairakan
