Justina is married and has three children. Two of the children are married while the youngest just finished school last year. Justina owns the house where she lives with her children and grandchildren. The house is in the Bautista Saavedra area of El Alto city.

Justina only completed up to third grade of primary school as she comes from a rural area. She now makes a living producing blankets and also has an income from the public transport services she offers, a business which her son runs.

Justina needs this loan to buy bricks, sand and cement to build another room in her house. She will then have more space.

Justina's dream is to finish building her house and for each of her children to have their own apartment.

This is the fourth time that Justina has applied for a loan with IMPRO, and the second time she has done so with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand and cement to build another room in her house and provide her family with more comfort.

loans.name: Ruth Maritza

texts.es:
Ruth Maritza tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, cerveza y otros productos, es una madre emprendedora ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra a abarrotes para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ruth Martinez is 37 years old and lives with her children in the Oyotún district.  Oyotún's residents work in agriculture, retail and livestock.  It is located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

She works selling groceries, beer and other products.  She is an entrepreneurial mother.  She has requested a loan of 3000 nuevos soles to purchase groceries to stock her business, so she can increase her earnings for her family.

loans.use: purchase groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
María del Pilar tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de belleza desde hace tres años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 200 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María del Pilar is 25 years old and lives with her husband and their children in the Cayaltí district.  Its residents work in agriculture, retail and cattle-raising.  It is located in the Chiclayo province which belongs to the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.  

She has worked selling clothing and beauty products for the past three years.  Her business is located in her home.  She is seeking a loan of 1200 nuevos soles to purchase merchandise to stock her business and increase her earnings for her family.

loans.use: purchase seasonal clothing for children, women and men.

loans.name: Almardon

texts.ru:
Алмардон родился в районе Кубадиён и по сей день живет там с женой и двумя детьми. Ему 49 лет. У него среднее образование. Дети Алмардона уже подросли и зарабатывают себе на жизнь. Старший сын находится в России и работаем там.   
В настоящее время Алмардон вместе с женой занимаются купле-продажей скота. Данный бизнес они начали два года тому назад. Они в основном выращивают крупнорогатый скот, откармливают его в течение месяца и затем продают с наценкой на местном скотном рынке. Благодаря этому бизнесу Алмардон обеспечивает свою семью. Сейчас Алмардон просит кредит, чтобы закупить пару молодых бычков. Он хочет увеличить поголовье продаваемого скота и таким образом увеличить бюджет семьи.
texts.en:
Almardon was born in the Qubadiyon region and still lives there with his wife and two children. He is 49 years old and has a high school education. His children have already grown up and live independently. His eldest son is working in Russia. 

Almardon and his wife currently buy and sell cattle. They started a business two years ago. They primarily raise cattle, fatten them for a month, and then sell them at the local livestock market. Almardon is able to provide for his family thanks to this business. Now he is requesting a loan to purchase a pair of young bulls. He wants to sell more cattle and thus increase the family's budget.

loans.use: To purchase a pair of young bulls in order to sell more livestock and thus increase the family budget

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo, a 40-year-old married man, lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in motorcycle transportation and also does farming as a side income activity. He started the business in order to raise funds to look after his children and eradicate poverty. He faces a difficulty of poor roads that cause him constant mechanical breakdowns.

In spite of this, he desires to own more motorcycles and educate his children to higher institutions of learning. Deo intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu is 47 years old, a widow, and lives in Kakata Town.  She has six children aged between 12 and 29. Only three are in school and live at home.  She did not go to school.

For the past eight years, she has been selling oil from a table in the market. She focuses on palm oil mainly. She will buy more palm oil to resell.  She established the business with a loan from her mother. She encounters few problems in her business other than the high rate of USD.  She enjoys the profit she makes every day. Her plans are to build a shop and a house for her children.

loans.use: will buy more palm oil to resell.

loans.name: José Abel De Jesús

texts.es:
José de 67 años de edad,  es  casado convive junto a su esposa, estudio hasta sexto grado. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa que le apoya en la actividades agrícolas y en el ordeño de las vacas.

 José se dedica  a la agricultura oficio que aprendió de sus padres,  para llegar a la parcela camina 3  Km y trabajan durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en la tarde se dedica a cuidar las vacas que poseen.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una yunta de bueyes, que necesita para poder arar la tierra donde cultiva y podrá obtener un ingreso adicional por arar otras parcelas lo que le ayudara a mantener a su familia.

Su deseo es  comprar un terreno para sembrar y donde tener sus animales.
texts.en:
José, 67 years old, is married and lives with his wife. He studied until sixth grade. He gets up at 5 a.m. to farm and milk the cows, assisted by his wife.

José learned to be a farmer from his parents. In order to get to their plots of land, he and his wife walk 3 kilometers and work all morning. His wife also takes care of domestic tasks. In the afternoon they milk the cows they own.

He is requesting a loan to purchase a team of oxen that he needs to plow the land. This will enable him to earn extra income by plowing his neighbors’ plots and help him to support his family.

He wants to buy land in order to farm and keep animals.

loans.use: to purchase a team of oxen.

loans.name: Lavdim

texts.en:
Lavdim is a 44-year-old married father of six children who lives in the south central part of the country. 

For the past nine years, his focus has been on agriculture and livestock activity. He has just returned from migration and has lived away for a very long time. While he was away his wife took care of the agricultural activities. 

He is requesting a loan because he needs to pay for the agricultural land certification documents. Kindly note that he cannot plant on this land without paying for the documents. Lavdim has been a long term client of VFA and has been consistent with the payments.

loans.use: to pay for the agricultural land certification registration documents

loans.name: Banabas

texts.en:
Banabas is a tea farmer aged twenty eight years old. He works three days in a week and gives the farming business an average of eight hours of work per day. His tea garden is located in a rural area in Kyamuhunga where he has been since 2009. 

He started the business with the objective of getting income to cater for his family. His major customer is the tea factory which buys all his tea. In addition to tea farming Barnabas also owns a butchery that gives him additional income which he uses to cater for the needs of his family.

He would like to use the loan money of two million (2,000,000) Ugandan shillings to buy fertilizer, so that he can boost the fertility of the soil and hence harvest more tea. 

He hopes to expand his business in future and he believes that then his profits will be much more than what he gets presently. Unfavourable weather is his major challenge since this affects his gardens, especially in the rainy season. But despite the challenges he faces now, he is hopeful that he will beat the odds and make money from growing and selling tea.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Guralie

texts.en: Guralie did repairs to their family home with the previous loan and now her husband who has been working in the construction field, needed to buy some relevant tools for his profession.

loans.use: To buy construction tools for her husband who does construction work

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María de 69 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado y es una persona acompañada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. María se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposo, para realizar sus actividades comerciales.

María se dedica a la venta de frutas de temporada, oficio que le  enseño su madre, durante el día vende en el mercado de la localidad y su esposo trabaja en las parcelas, camina 3 K.m. para llegar y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedica a recolectar frutas para que su esposa lleve a vender el siguiente día. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar un puesto en el mercado, ya que actualmente ofrece los productos en la calle y eso le dificulta, ya que si le sobra producto tiene que llevarla nuevamente a su vivienda

 María espera, que con los ingresos que obtiene de venta de frutas  y  de la siembra,  arreglar el techo de su vivienda ya que en la temporada de invierno se filtra el agua y le daña la mercadería.
texts.en:
María is 69 years old and studied up to sixth grade. She is married - her husband works as a farmer. María gets up with her husband at 5am in order to carry out her daily activities. 

María makes a living selling seasonal fruits, a trade that she learned from her mother. María spends the day selling her goods at the local market while her husband is working on their plots of land. María's husband must walk three kilometres to arrive at the land and, in the afternoon, he collects the fruits that his wife will sell at the market the following day.

María is applying for a loan from CrediCampo in order to pay for a stall at the market. María currently sells her goods in the street and this is difficult as, if she has stock leftover at the end of the day, she must carry it home again.

María hopes that - with her income from growing and selling fruit - she will be able to repair the roof of her home. During the winter season water leaks through it and damages her stock.

loans.use: to buy a stall at the market.

loans.name: Ivica

texts.en:
Ivica is 33 years old, single and lives in one of the minority communities with his parents, who both receive a pension. Ivica works hard and is employed in a municipality. He also raises pigs, and now he would like to start his own agricultural business since he already owns some land that he would be able to plant corn and wheat on. In order to start this business, Ivica will need a loan to purchase a tractor. 

He believes that adding this type of agricultural business to his routine will provide much profit and additional income in order to save for his future. He will be able to also work on the land of others in the area for a fee as well. By working hard and with various sources of income, Ivica hopes to provide better living conditions for his family. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase a tractor

loans.name: Rahman

texts.en: Rahman is 52 year-old married man. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar region. Rahman lives in the country-side and has good opportunities to expand his business, which is livestock and farming. For more than 15 years he has been a farmer and has a great deal of experience. His livestock is always in good health and so Rahman has many regular clients. He wants to expand his business and have higher monthly profits. He is requesting a loan of 1,500 AZN to purchase more livestock. He plans to use the profits from the loan to improve his living situation.This is going to be his 1st loan. Rahman hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Majukumu Group

texts.en:
Evergeline, who is in her late 30s, is single with one daughter who is still going to school.  She has been selling different types of clothes for three years now.  She works from 8 am to 8 pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Evergeline's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase the stock of clothing, and has paid back all her loans successfully. 

She used the profit to cover household expenses and saved some in her bank account.  

She will use this loan to buy clothes of different types to sell at Christmas time.  She is so happy with the loan.  She dreams of owning a big clothes shop.

Evergeline will share this loan with her loan group "MAJUKUMU"; the two members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes of different types to sell  at Christmas time

loans.name: Juan Aristides

texts.es: Juan de 35 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos de 16 años, 12 años, 8 años, y 4 años de edad. Juan trabaja como albañil, dicho oficio es el que el que le permite llevar el sustento a su familia  y mantener la economía de su hogar. Su vivienda es su principal patrimonio y futura herencia para sus hijos por lo que con mucho esfuerzo va mejorando. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios (arena, cemento y grava) para pavimentar el piso del corredor de la vivienda ya que actualmente es de tierra y cuando llueve se hace lodo  e imposibilita el paso.
texts.en: Juan is 35 years old. He lives in his own home together with his life partner and his children who are 16, 12, 8 and 4 years old. Juan works as a mason and this profession is what allows him to provide sustenance to his family and to maintain his household economy. He owns his own home which his children will inherit in the future that he works very hard on to improve. He is seeking a credit from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of the necessary materials (sand, cement and gravel) to pave the floors in the halls of his home because they are currently made of  dirt and when it rains they turn to mud and are impossible to pass through.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and gravel to pave the floors in the halls of his home.

loans.name: Mayram

texts.en:
This young and pretty lady lives in the village of Norashen, in Gegharkunik region. Mayram lives with her parents and her brother. She is 24 years of age, and unfortunately, her family has not enough resources to provide for her to have higher education. Right now, she is attending some computer courses, with the hope that in the near future she will manage to find some convenient job. Mayram’s brother is a hired worker. Her mother is a housewife, and at the same time she runs their farming and agricultural activities. In their farm they have five cows, three calves, two bulls, twenty sheep, a horse, five beehives and twenty chickens.

Unfortunately, Mayram’s father has serious problems connected with his heart, and at this moment, he is incapacitated. The doctor is sure that he needs heart surgery. So her mother does all the farming activities herself, and Mayram tries somehow to help her mother. Their farm products (dairy products, meat, eggs and honey) they sell through the re-sellers, and the income from this is used for their family's needs, which are a lot at this moment.

Mayram asks a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams. She plans to use it for her father’s heart surgery, which is very urgent for her father.

loans.use: to pay for her father’s heart surgery.

loans.name: Vigen

texts.en:
Vigen is a 24-year-old living in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region. Vigen lives with his parents and with his younger brother. Vigen’s parents are engaged in the farming and agriculture business. His older brother is already married and lives separately with his family.

Vigen and his younger brother work at the gas station. Vigen also specializes in cooking, which he did for several years to earn a living. Then he went abroad to work for the Russian Federation. But he recently got married and, in order to stay with his family, he left that profession.

Vigen has a very nice and pretty wife, who is soon giving birth to a baby. Vigen explains that he is unbelievably happy and impatient for their baby to be born. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 250,000 AMD in order to buy clothes, a crib, and other necessities for his baby.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, a crib, and other necessities for his baby

loans.name: Temboni Group

texts.en:
Catherine, who is in her early 30s, is married with two daughters who are still at school.  She has been a food vendor for three years how.  She works from 6 am to 9 pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Catherine's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy cooking oil, baking flour, and maize flour.  She has successfully paid back her loan.  She used the profit to pay for school fees and to buy small items for the food store. 

She is doing great and happy with the loan. She will use this loan to buy rice, maize flour, beans, salt, onions, and charcoal.  

She dreams of being an international businesswoman.

Catherine will share this loan with her loan group "TEMBONI"; the three members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize flour, beans, salt, onions, and charcoal.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en: Joseline is 39 years old. She is married to a house builder and they have both four children. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past ten years. She wants the loan to buy more clothes commonly known as bitenge for ladies. She plans to use the profits for reinvesting in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Emelienne

texts.en: Emelienne is 59 years old. She is a widow with three children. She sells bananas and she has requested the loan to buy more bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business. She is very happy for the previous loan, which helped in boosting the business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Carine

texts.en: Carine is aged 41. She is married to a driver and has been selling clothes for the past ten years. With the loan, she wants to buy more cloths for ladies to sell. She plans to use the profits for expanding her business and saving for a better future. Carine has progressively transformed her business as well her life from the business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Tekla

texts.en: This is Tekla, who is 18-years-old and lives in Kutaisi.  Her parents and brother live together with her. The only income for the family is her father's war veterans' pension of 122 GEL. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as they have no source of income and live in under the poverty level. As a result of  the above mentioned situation,Tekla lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Tekla to get a loan of $3,000 to start a trading business.  She will purchase stock such as snacks, chewing gums, soft drinks and other food products. She has already rented a place where the store will be located. Tekla thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in a great location. After the general store is opened, the family will have a stable income which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future.  With the support of the Start Up program, Tekla will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: To open a mini-store

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 50-years-old. She is a mother of eight children, and they all go to school. She sells local breweries; she has spent five years in the business. She has requested a loan to buy more local breweries for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more local breweries for sale

loans.name: Theimuraz

texts.en: Theimuraz is a 30-year-old young man, who has his own family: a wife and two small children. One of them goes to school and the other goes to kindergarten. His wife is a housekeeper and looks after her babies. Theimuraz is unemployed at the moment. As he can’t find a job, he decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Theimuraz applied for credit from MFO Credo (Micro Finance Organization Credo). His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of $2000 will help Theimuraz to purchase a secondhand car. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them inter-city. Theimuraz is a very enthusiastic and hard-working person with a great desire to ensure that his children have a good education for progressing in life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. Theimuraz is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a married woman, age 63, with 10 children.  She lives on the outskirt of Kyotera town with her husband and four grandchildren for whom she pays school fees. She deals in charcoal selling and a beer business; she supplements her income with agriculture, where she grows maize, beans, and banana plantations.

She started her businesses in 2003; she works 7 days a week. Margret started this business to get enough food for the family and pay school fees for her grandchildren. 

She has acquired this loan to boost the business and buy beer, since  the Christmas season demand for beer is high. 

She said her clients are local people from around and nearby villages.

Her hopes for the future are to be the leading supplier of beer within her area, and to educate her children.  The challenge she faces is lack of enough capital for the business. 

She describes herself as an honest and hard working lady, and encourages other clients to apply for loans to develop themselves.

loans.use: To buy beer to sell

loans.name: Beaular Heights Group

texts.en:
Queen is into buying and selling of groceries and electric good. She buys from South Africa, Botswana, and Zambia, depending on the amount and type of order she needs. All the other group members are doing the same business as that of the chairperson.

Queen is still single, and looking after two dependents.

She is also into farming and poultry business, though at a small scale.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and electrical goods from South Africa to sell.

loans.name: Colette

texts.en: Colette is a Cameroonian aged forty-nine and married with two children. The older child is fifteen-years-old and the younger is thirteen and both are in secondary school. She has been in this business for the past nine years which makes her very experienced and stable. Her business is is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase her profit by 35 percent and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy raw food to cook and sell.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 31-year-old married woman living with her spouse and 3 children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a vendor and sells fruit in their hometown. He goes to the fruit market daily to buy fresh fruit. He is very famous in the community due to the freshness of his fruit. He has been selling fruit for many years, and because of this he understands the needs of his customers. To cope with the demand, Safia requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more fruit, especially oranges.

Safia is very thankful to Kiva and the Field Partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fruit for resale.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina  es casada (su esposo regresó del exterior y ahora viven juntos); tiene 2 hijos, el mayor ya termino sus estudios secundarios y su hija menor tiene 9 meses, viven en la casa de sus suegros la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Bolivar de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella solo estidio hasta el nivel primario, se dedica a la venta de golosinas y refrescos en un kiosco que tiene, su esposo es chofer interdepartamental el solo llega una vez al mes a su casa.
El crédito lo requiere para  la compra la compra de material de construccion ya que realizara refacciones en los techos y paredes de la vivienda por que se aproxima la epoca de lluvias. Necesita comprar calaminas, clavos, cemento y estuco.
El sueño de Ctalina es tener su casa propia.
Es la sexta  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la tercera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Catalina is married (her husband returned from abroad and now they live together). She has two children. Her eldest child just finished high school and her young daughter is 9 months old. They live in the home of her in-laws which is located in the Villa Bolivar zone of the city of El Alto. Catalina only studied through primary school. She works selling candies and refreshments from a kiosk that she has. Her husband is an interstate driver and he only stays at their home once a month. Catalina is seeking this loan to purchase construction materials because she needs to make repairs to the ceilings and walls of her home soon because the rainy season is approaching. She needs to purchase roofing, nails, cement and stucco. Catalina's dream is to have her own home. This is the sixth time that she is seeking a loan through IMPRO and the third time through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase roofing, nails, cement and stucco to repair the ceilings and walls of the home where she lives before the rainy season begins.

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es:
Ana Maribel tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores cerdos, carneros y cuyes en la parte posterior a su domicilio, se dedica a esta labor para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Maribel is 40 years old and lives with her husband in the Cayaltí district.  Its residents work in agriculture, retail and cattle-raising.  It is located in the Chiclayo province which is in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.  

She works raising and selling small animals such as: pigs, rams and guinea pigs in the back of her house.  She works in this business to hep her husband with their household expenses.  She has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to purchase  animal feed to fatten her animals in order to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: purchase feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en:
Lukia is married with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (cousin).

Lukia has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for a few months. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and bags of bread. She works in the shop six days out of every week and sells on retail basis only.

Lukia also generates additional income from selling piped water. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and ever increasing prices of commodities. 

Lukia is aspiring of owning a wholesale shop and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and bags of bread.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

Mwaka has operated a charcoal selling business for the past 4 years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. She cites price fluctuation and seasonality as her major challenges.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol  is a single mother of two children and all her children go to school. She has a business of selling airtime and has a pay phone and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more airtime and also load airtime for her pay phone. 

She generates additional income from selling tomatoes. She works near the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She aspires to invest in used clothes and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To  buy airtime and  also to load airtime for her pay phone.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a single mother of three children and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

She has had a business of a restaurant for five years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, cooking oil, beans, cassava, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes. 

She works in a market and sells on a retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a big hotel and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more  bunches of green bananas, beef, cooking oil, beans, cassava, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Jeimmy

texts.es:
Es una joven de 24 años que desea estudiar  salud oral ya que le llama la atención por  lo general  la medicina y ve por este medio como ayudar en la salud oral de las personas para que así puedan mantener una gran sonrisa.
Quiere como objetivo lograr en un futuro especializare en esta rama, aprender mas  y ser excelente en su profesión.
Con eso mismo también lograr los objetivos personales familiares y profesionales ya  que aspira a inculcar también a la familia y  a las personas que la rodean, lo importante que es mantener una buena salud oral, realmente quiere aprender  y enseñar  todos los conocimientos .
Quiere desempeñarse muy bien laboralmente y demostar que realmente hace muy bien lo que le gusta y asi  ofrecer  un excelente servicio a la comunidad
Necesita el convenio con kiva  ya que económicamente no cuenta con muchos recursos económicos, ya que tiene otros compromisos , gastos etc, por eso mismo necesita de este convenio para que le colabore con un descuento y asi le quede mas cómodo  para financiar la carrera.
texts.en:
Jeimmy is a 24-year-old young woman who wants to study oral health because she is interested in medicine in general; by this means she sees a way to help with people's oral health so that they can maintain a great smile.

Her objective is to be able to specialize in this area in the future, to learn more and to be excellent in her profession. She also wants to achieve her personal, family and professional objectives, as she aspires to impress upon her family and the people around her how important it is to maintain good oral health. She really wants to learn and pass on all of her knowledge. She wants to perform very well in her work and to demonstrate that she really does what she likes very well, thus offering an excellent service to the community.

She needs this arrangement with Kiva, as financially she doesn't have a lot of resources since she has other commitments, expenses, etc. This is why she needs this arrangement, so she can get a discount. In this way it will be more comfortable for her to finance her education.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition

loans.name: Liszy Estefani

texts.es:
Liszy Estefani, es una mujer de 19 años emprendedora, luchadora, con ganas se salir adelante y   desde muy pequeña tiene la expectativa  de estudiar Medicina o alguna carrera relacionada con la salud porque siempre le a gustado ayudarle a los demás y  siente que es la vocación de ella, en el 2012 se graduó de bachiller y  no pudo ingresar a estudiar Medicina puesto que no tenía  los recursos necesarios para conseguir todo el dinero  que  se necesita, entonces quiso estudiar enfermería y escogió este prestigioso instituto  porque le pareció un excelente lugar; pero no logró inscribirse en el primer semestre porque no tenía la plata de la matrícula, ni de la pensión, además ella tiene una niña de 2 años  y no  consiguió  quien la cuidara mientras ella estudiaba, por ello no puede trabajar y no tiene los recursos suficientes para pagar la carrera ; mientras tanto los papas y el novio le ayudan con los gastos de ella y la bebe; por otro lado la mama trabaja por días y hace lo posible para ahorrar y conseguir el dinero para que la hija  pueda cumplir el sueño.
Liszy Estefani  logro ingresar a estudiar auxiliar de enfermería.  Ya pasando seis meses Liszy pudo cursar el primer semestre de auxiliar de enfermería, esta muy feliz porque ya casi puede lograr la meta que tiene, a aprendido muchas cosas sobres los cuidados, las protecciones y como ser una buena enfermera; gracias a el convenio que le a brindado kiva con el descuento  a podido pagar el estudio y así cada vez llegar mas cerca a cumplir los sueños.
Liszy Estefani  quiere ser alguien en la vida, quiere salir adelante y sacar adelante a la hija y  que  ella se sienta  orgullosa de la madre…
 
…Muchas Gracias...
texts.en:
Liszy Estefani is a 19 year old, entrepreneurial fighter with a desire to get ahead.  From a young age, she wanted to study medicine or another career in the health field because she always liked helping others, and believes that it is the career for her.  In 2012, she graduated from high school but was not able to enroll in medical school because she did not have the necessary resources to put together the money she needed.  Instead, she decided to study nursing and chose this prestigious institution because it seemed like a great place.  However, she was not able to enroll in her first semester because she did not have enough money for tuition or room and board.  She also has a two year old daughter, and was not able to find anyone to take care of her while she was in school.  She is not able to work and does not have the sufficient funds to pay for her education.  Meanwhile, her parents and her boyfriend help her with her and her child's expenses.  Her mother works during the day and tries her best to save and earn enough money to make her daughter's dream possible.

Liszy Estefani was able to enter school to become a nursing assistant.  After six months, she was able complete her first semester of nursing assistant school.  She is very happy because she is close to reaching her goal.  She has learned many things about precautions, protections and how to be a good nurse.  Thanks to the agreement with Kiva for the discount, she has been able to pay for her education, and continue to get closer to reaching her dreams.  Liszy Estefani wants to be somebody in life, wants to get ahead, and get her daughter ahead and make her proud of her mother.  Thank you very much.

loans.use: pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 46 years old and is married with two children aged 9 and 29 years old. Her children are living with her in the airport community of Liberia. 

Esther is educated to the 8th grade. For the past 22 years, she has been selling dried fish in the local market. The main problem that she facing is a goods shortage, since she does not have a save store. She likes her business because it provides for her needs, and her husband also sells along with her. 

Esther is requesting a loan to purchase dried fish to expand their business, and she plans are to educate her children and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish to expand their business.

loans.name: Sanyu Development Group

texts.en:
Madina is a 40-year-old resident of Kyengera. She is widowed with four children and is a member of the Sanyu Development Group. 

Madina is a market vendor who sells different agricultural products such as carrots, oranges, and green onions among others. With this kind of business, she has been able to educate her children, buy a small piece of land, and constructed a house for her family although it is not yet complete. Therefore, Madina needs a loan to complete the construction of her house.

loans.use: to complete her residential house.

loans.name: Wito Group

texts.en:
Warioba, who is in his late 40s, is married and has four children who are still going to school. He has been running a business, selling livestock, since 1989. He works from 4:00am to 9:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Warioba's 19th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the number of his livestock. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profits to pay school fees and to start building his house. He appreciates the loans, which have made his life really successful. He dreams of building his house.

He will use this current loan to buy livestock and meet his customers' demand. Warioba will share this loan with his loan group, Wito, which has seven members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy and sell more livestock

loans.name: Glenda Patricia

texts.es:
Glenda de 41 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, trabaja como panadera, en esfuerzo conjunto con su esposo y dos de sus hijos.

Tiene ya dos años de trabajar en el negocio propio, pero de experiencia tiene más tiempo, pues trabajó muchos años en otras empresas panificadoras.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar materia prima para elaborar pan dulce, tal como: azúcar, sal, huevos, colorantes artificiales para alimento, levadura, harina y equipo de trabajo, ya que en época navideña es muy grande la demanda.

En un futuro Glenda le gustaría tener una panadería reconocida por la calidad de su producto, tener una mayor venta y del negocio mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Glenda is 41 years old. She is married and she has three children. She works as a bread baker, an effort she undertakes together with her husband and two of their children. She has spent two years working on her own business, but she has even more experience in the past because she worked for many years in other bakeries. This loan will be used for the purchase of primary materials to make sweet breads like: sugar, salt, eggs, food coloring, leavening, flour and work equipment because there is a lot of demand during the Christmas season.

In the future Glenda would like to have a bakery that is recognized for the quality of its product and to increase her sales from the business to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, eggs, food coloring, leavening, flour and work equipment.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is a Cameroonian, aged fifty-two and married with five children. The oldest is seventeen in high school, while the youngest is five in primary school. He has been in this business for the past ten years which makes him very experienced and stable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase his turnover by thirty percent. His standard of living will be improved as well.

loans.use: to buy stuff (powdered soup, soft drinks, beers, biscuits, etc.)

loans.name: Lucie Brigitte Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a Cameroonian, aged forty-eight. She is divorced and has seven children. The oldest is nineteen and in high school, while the youngest is nine and in primary school.

Florence has been in her current business for seven months, which makes her experienced and stable. Her business is likely to succeed, because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase her profit by ten percent. Her standard of living will be improved.

loans.use: To buy food to cook and sell at her restaurant

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal APU KCAMER, el banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Huarqui en el distrito de Coya, provincia de Calca, departamento de Cusco.
El socio Daniel continua trabajando como albañil para las distintas obras que solicitan sus servicios, él socio es una persona responsable, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este trabajo el cual le trae satisfacciones personales y economicas, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas como combo,brochas,reglas de madera entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido con los inversionistas de kiva y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Daniel is a member of the communal bank, APU KCAMER. The bank is located in the community of Huarqqui in the Coya district in the province of Calca, in the department of Cusco. Daniel continues to work as a mason on different projects that solicit his services. He is a responsible person and has spent a long time dedicated to this work which brings him both personal and economic satisfaction. Daniel desires to be able to continue working this way so he can continue supporting his family. Daniel is seeking a loan to purchase tools like a sledgehammer, brushes and wooden rulers, among other items. He is grateful to the Kiva investors and he promises to comply with his established payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase tools like a sledgehammer, brushes and wooden rulers, among others.

loans.name: Eneyda Solans

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “APU KAMER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Coya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Eneida Solans, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de crianza de cuyes, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos en las distintas ferias que se realizan , la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eneyda Solans belongs to the "Apu Kamer" communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Coya in the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.

Eneyda Solans continues making a living from the business of raising guinea pigs. She has had this business for years, and it is going well thanks to her daily dedication to her business. She raises these small animals to then sell them in the various markets in her area. She is a responsible and dedicated person. 

Eneyda Solans wants to keep working in order to keep supporting her family in this manner. She is asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs. She feels grateful for the loan and commits to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She is married with three children, all of whom go to school.

Dama sells goat meat to various butcheries and hotels. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil, a father of three, has been photographed with his cow. He has been in Greece for long time and came back to Albania from there when financial troubles became known in our neighbor country. In Greece, he did seasonal work in construction, and he has been practicing the same skills in his village in addition to livestock and agricultural activities. 

Vasil has been selling raw milk to a nearby dairy farm and now he wants to invest in buying some baby calves from a good breed. He says “I want to expend the livestock activity, it is worthwhile it. Albanians consume lots of dairy products, hence it is easy to sell the produce and make a good income from it in return."

loans.use: to buy baby calves

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in Tbilisi city, Georgia. She lives with her two sons and daughter. Lia's husband lives abroad and the only source of income for her is the transferred money from him. One of her sons works as an artisan with private orders, which generates 300 GEL monthly. 

Lia has great desire to be involved in her own activity and has requested a loan. Lia's application was approved within the start-up program, which enables people to start or re-start businesses. With the loan 1200 USD, Lia will purchase stock of used shoes and start trading. It will give her chance to make her own income and gain financial independence. Lia is grateful to all Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: to purchase stock of used shoes and start trading

loans.name: Jafaru

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 27-year-old Jafaru from Wara Wara. He is single and trying to upgrade his future. He was a shop assistant; he started his business to change his status of living.

Jafaru runs a building material business within a busy market area. He sells cement, zinc, nail, and locker doors. He has been running this business since 2012. He works at the business from 7:00am until 6:00pm, 6 days per week. Jafaru says that he is working very hard to become successful.

Jafaru has requested a loan to purchase cement, zinc, nails, and locker doors for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and find a wife. In the future, he plans to become a wholesaler. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cement, zinc, nails, and locker doors for resale.

loans.name: Sanene Group

texts.en:
Sharifa, who is in her mid-40s, is married and has four, grown-up children. She has been running two businesses, selling clothes and selling broiler chickens (which are for meat, not for eggs). She has been in these businesses for five years. She works from 6:00am to 8:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sharifa's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep increasing her stock of clothes, and to buy chicks to raise for broiler chicken. She has successfully paid back her loans. She used the profits to pay school fees and household expenses. She is doing great with the loans. She will use this new loan to buy clothes to resell and chicken feed for the broilers. She dreams of building her own house.

Sharifa will share this loan with her loan group, Sanene, which has four members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell and chicken feed for raising broilers.

loans.name: Atigue

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Atigue from Wara Wara, Makeni Northern area, in Sierra Leone. He is single with two children. One of his children is going to school.  He stated his goal is to change his status of living.

Atigue runs an auto spare parts business within a busy market area; he sells motor bikes, spare parts and engine oil, and different kind of machine spare parts. He has been running this business since 2011. He works at the business from 7 AM until  6 PM, six days per week.  Atigue says that the main challenges to his business are price inflation and delay to supplies of the engine oil.

Atigue has requested a loan in order to purchase more motor bikes, spare parts and motor oil, and different kind of machine spare parts.  The extra income from this loan will allow him to open a savings account and take care of his family's welfare. In the future, he plans to become a wholesaler. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more motor bikes, spare part and motor oil, and different kind of machine spare parts.

loans.name: Sinneh

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Sinneh from Masuba, Makeni northern area in Sierra Leone. He is married with four children between the ages of 3 years and 16 years. One of his children is attending school. 

Sinneh runs a general stock business; He sells bags of rice, flour, and sugar. He has been running this business since 2010. He works at the business 12 hours per day and 6 days per week. Sinneh says that the main challenges to his business is price inflation.

Sinneh has requested a loan to buy more bags of rice, flour, and sugar for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow him to become a successful business man and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Sinneh plans to expand his business more than ever. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, flour, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Hassan from Masuba, Makeni Northern area in Sierra Leone. He is married and has 3 children. In 2003, Hassan established his retail business because he was trained to run the business from his parent. Hassan works at the business 6 days per week, from 8:00 a.m. until 5:30 p.m. He says that the main challenges to his business are price inflation and transportation problems.

Hassan requires a loan in order to purchase bags of rice and drinks to expand his business. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to change his status of living and to increase his business. In the future, Hassan plans to import rice from a neighboring country. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and drinks to expand his business.

loans.name: Ibrahim        S

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Ibrahim from Masuba Makeni, Northern area in Sierra Leone. He is divorced and has 1 child aged 6 years, who is currently attending school. 

In 2010, Ibrahim established his electrical business. He was a sales assistant to his brother but when the shop was closed, he could not get employment elsewhere, so he decided to run his own business out of the little savings he made. Ibrahim works at the business 6 days per week, from 7:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. He says that the main challenge to his business is the high cost of transportation.

Ibrahim requires a loan in order to buy more chargers, extensions and cables for resale. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to renovate his house and increase his business. In the future, Ibrahim plans to build a permanent business place. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more chargers, extensions and cables for resale.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Abdul from Masuba, Makeni Northern area in Sierra Leone. He is married and has 4 children, three of whom are attending school. Abdul was a shop keeper; he started his business to change his status of living.

Abdul runs an auto spare parts business within a busy market area, selling motor bike spare parts, motor oil and different kinds of machine spare parts. He has been running this business since 2000. Abdul works at the business 6 days per week, from 7:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. He says that the main challenges to his business are price inflation and custom duties.

Abdul has requested a loan in order to purchase more motor bike spare parts, motor oil and different kinds of machine spare parts.  The extra income from this loan will allow him to open a savings account and to take care of his family's welfare. In the future, he plans to become a wholesaler. Abdul thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more motor bike spare parts, motor oil and different kinds of machine spare parts

loans.name: Anamelva

texts.es: Anamelva, de 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene 02 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Anamelva se dedica a la venta de comidas de lunes a viernes atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes logrando tener una buena acogida y demanda, lleva 08 años en este negocio. Le gusta su negocio pues comenta le gusta cocinar aprendiendo de su madre los secretos para una buena sazón, así como el ingreso económico que le permite pagar sus cuentas y gastos de su hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1200. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El  monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes tales como arroz, huevos, pollos, entre otros para preparar sus comidas.
texts.en:
Anamelva is 33 years old, is married and has two children that she lives with in a house she owns. Anamelva makes a living by selling food from Monday to Friday. She has earned a good reception and demand by attending to her customers in a very friendly manner. She has had this business for eight years. She likes her business because she says she likes to cook, having learned the secrets of good seasoning from her mother. She also likes the financial income that allows her to pay her bills and household expenses. 

At this time she is requesting 1,200 Peruvian nuevos soles. For this she hopes to count on your collaboration so she may nail down her plans. She also commits to making her monthly payments in a punctual manner. She will invest the requested amount in buying ingredients such as rice, eggs and chickens, among other items to prepare her food.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, eggs and chickens, among other items

loans.name: Ayesata

texts.en:
Meet 52-year-old Ayesata from  Masuba, Makeni Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children. In 2000, Ayesata established her retail business.  She began her business because she wants to create a means of survival. She works at the business fifteen hours, six days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and high competition in the market.

Ayesata requires a loan in order to purchase cigarettes, drinks, and soap to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Ayesata plans to expand her business beyond expectation. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks, and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a first time borrower applying for a loan of 5,000,000 UGX. He is single and stays in Banda next to Kyambogo University. He has a poultry farm project which he has been engaged in for two years. He says he has a ready market for his eggs and a broiler in the Banda area and finds no problem with supply. Thomas’s client demand has increased but he is unable to meet them; therefore, he is applying for a loan to expand his poultry house so that he is able to meet all of the demands of his customers. He has been able to contribute to his community through providing jobs at the poultry house to a few young, jobless Ugandans. He is hard working and focused.

loans.use: to expand his poultry house.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a first time borrower applying for a loan of UGX 1,500,000. She is married and has one child. Evelyn stays in the city outskirts and sells phones in Wandegeya, near Makerere University.  She has customers since she is on a highway with a ready market of university students. 

Evelyn wants to bring in more phones from China but has inadequate capital. She is therefore applying for a loan to stock for the coming season (semester two) that is yet to begin. Evelyn predicts that her profits are going to rise with the help of the loan. She proposes to open up another branch within Kampala.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones to sell

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is 31 years old and married with two children. She runs a retail store in Masuba, Makeni northern area in Sierra Leone. She was a housewife, but she started a business to empower herself.

She has been in this business since 2006, and sells pure water, drinks, cigarettes and biscuits within her community.  She says despite the challenges, she has a desire to educate her children.

Mariama requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchases more pure water, drinks, cigarettes and biscuits to expand her business. 

She says the extra income from this loan will help her to take care of her family welfare, and increase her business. 

In the future, she would like expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchases more pure water, drinks, cigarettes and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Mariama from Masuba northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children. 

In 2007, Mariama established her retail business. She is a shopkeeper; she began her business because she was motivated by her colleague to run her personal business. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a poor road network towards her area of operation.

Mariama requires a loan to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business. 

She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. 

In the future, Mariama plans to expand her business beyond expectations. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Las 19 integrantes de este comité son mujeres muy trabajadoras, que han visto una gran oportunidad para ella y sus familias por medio del programa de comité de mujeres.
Una de estas mujeres es la Sra. Leida, quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas en general, y es por medio de este trabajo que ayuda a su familia, y tiene los ingresos que necesita para poder darles todo lo que ella no pude tener. Comenta que son los fines de semana cuando más venta tiene, y que siempre quiere estar surtida para poder dar a sus clientes lo que necesitan.
Leida pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas varias, que le permitirá seguir con sus ventas, a la vez que lucha por mejorar y crecer. Agradecen todas por la ayuda que están recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The 19 members of this committee are extremely hardworking women. They see the Women's Committee Program as a great opportunity for themselves and their families.

One of these women is Sra. Leida, who sells beverages. Through her work, she is able to help her family and have the income she needs in order to give them everything that she was not able to have. Leida says that the weekends are when she sells the most, so she always wants to be stocked in order to provide what her customers need.

Leida is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of various beverages. This will enable her to continue her sales as she strives to improve and grow. All of the members appreciate the assistance that has been given to them so that they can continue growing.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell.

loans.name: Zaratu

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Zaratu is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing porridge and also owns a provision shop in Likpe Bala (near Hohoe). She has been involved in this enterprise for four years. Zaratu is married and has six children. Her husband is currently unemployed. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, the proceeds from her business go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. Zaratu wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, which will allow her to sell greater quantities of washing powder, sachets of Milo, milk powder, tin milk, biscuits, and candies. In the long term, Zaratu plans to reinvest future profits into her business and also into her porridge sales.  This will help her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels allowing her to sell greater quantities of washing powder, sachets of Milo, milk powder, tin milk, biscuits, and candies.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella operates a business selling "Red-Red" (a traditional Ghanaian staple food that is largely made from spiced cow-peas, ripped plantains and palm oil). She prepares the "Red-Red" herself and subsequently sells it in Likpe Bala (near Hohoe). Stella is a divorcee with three children. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Stella uses her income to provide for the entire family. Stella will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of ingredients to aid her overall "Red-Red" sales. As a junior high school graduate, Stella understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, so she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of ingredients to improve her overall "Red-Red" sales.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is divorced and has two children. After successfully graduating junior high school, Grace is now an established businesswoman. She sells local rice and paddy rice in Likpe Bala (near Hohoe). She has been actively involved in this business for about four years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Grace uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Grace will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of paddy rice from the farmer, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of paddy rice from the farmer, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 43 years old and has five children, three of whom are in school.

Gina is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Gina requested a 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gina has been in business for eight years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 64 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a buying and selling of nipa roofing material (palm fronds) in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa to sell.

Esperanza has been in this business for 25 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa (palm fronds for roofing) to sell

loans.name: Moriza

texts.en:
Moriza is 25 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Moriza has a general store business in the Philippines. Moriza requested a 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional household items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc.

Moriza has been in this business for one year. In the future, Moriza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional household items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is a young Cameroonian, aged thirty and single, without a child. He has been in this business for over seven years, which makes him very experienced and stable. His business is likely to succeed, because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase his turnover by fifteen percent. His standard of living will be improved, as well.

loans.use: to buy plastic utensils for resale

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is 36 years old and lives in Tappita city. She is married, and her husband is not working. They have 5 children aged 5 to 16. Only four are presently attending school, and they all live at home. For the past 8 years he has been selling plantains and peppers. She enjoys her business because of the profit she makes every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase additional plantains and peppers for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional plantains and peppers for her business.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: This is Cecelia. She is 41 years old and is a business woman who lives in Tappita which is in Nimba County. This region is rich in nature resources, and the living conditions are much better than in the capital city. Cecelia is a married with 3 children aged between 6 and 20, they are in school and live at home. Over 4 years she has been running a small shop in the local market. She spends 8 hours each day on her business. A problem she faces is the small income she earns. She is requesting a loan to purchase more plantains for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more plantains for her business.

loans.name: Anali

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “APU KAMER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Coya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Anali continua con su negocio de restaurant, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende diferentes tipos de platos como arroz con pollo, saltado entre otros, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de libreria, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa  siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el restaurant como arroz y aceite.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Anali is a member of the communal bank "APU KAMER." The bank is located in the district of Coya which is part of the province of Calca, in the department of Cusco. Anali continues with her restaurant business. She is successful with her business which is going well thanks to the effort that the puts into it everyday. She sells different kinds of meals, like rice with chicken and stir fried meat and potatoes, among others. At the same time she continues working for a bookstore. Anali is a responsible and entrepreneurial person and through these means she gets her family ahead. She is seeking a loan to purchase supplies for her restaurant like rice and oil. She is happy because of the loan and she promises to comply with her payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her restaurant like rice and oil.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “APU KAMER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Coya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Josefina; La socia continua con su negocio de venta de artesania, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende mantas y telares a sus clientes que le solicitan su mercaderia, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mantas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Josefina belongs to the "Apu Kamer" communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Coya in the province of Calca and department of Cusco.

Josefina continues with her business selling handicrafts. She has had this business for years and it is going well thanks to her daily dedication to her business. She sells blankets and looms to her customers, who request her merchandise.

Josefina wants to be able to keep working in order to keep supporting her family in this manner. She is asking for the loan to buy blankets for her business. She feels grateful for the loan and commits to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy blankets for her business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim, 48 years old, is married and has 5 children between the ages of 2 and 25 years. He runs a rice store in Masuba, Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone. He considered it as the best alternative for self-development. Ibrahim has been in this business since 1998, selling a variety of rice within a busy market area. He says that the main challenges to his business are transportation problems and storage facilities.

Ibrahim requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more rice for resale. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him to increase his business and to build a house. In the future, Ibrahim would like to become a rice distributor.

loans.use: to purchase more rice for resale

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 31-year-old Fatmata from Masuba Makeni, a northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with one child, six years old. 

In 2005, Fatmata established her pharmacy business. She is a medical nurse in the government hospital. She began her business because she considered it as a means of helping the community through medical care. She works at the business 13 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are taxation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more medical drugs for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to expand to a big hospital. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more medical drugs for resale.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie, 50 years old, lives in Kakata. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 18 and 32, two of whom are in school and living at home. Annie did not complete 8th grade. 

For the past five years, Annie has been selling rice by the cup from a table in the local market. She focuses on rice selling because it has more profit. Annie established the business with a loan from her mother. One of her problems is the distance required to buy the rice by bag. Annie enjoys how busy she is. Her dream is to own a provisions shop in the near future.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort, 38 years old, lives in Kakata. She has three children between the ages of 7 and 23 years old, all living at home and attending school. For the past six years, Comfort has been running a table, where she sells rice, oil, bitter balls (a tropical vegetable), peppers, etc.  She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her friends. Comfort is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, bitter balls, peppers, etc. for her business. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, bitter balls, peppers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Korto

texts.en:
Korto, 36 years old,  lives in Kakata. She is married and has 4 children aged between 7 and 21 years old, all in school and living at home. Korto did not go to school. 

For the past 3 years, Korto has been selling dry fish in the local market. She started this business with help from her husband and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry fish for her business. Korto enjoys her business and the profit she receives every day. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more dry fish for her business.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
Carlos  de 53 años de edad, es  casado convive junto a su esposa, estudio hasta sexto grado. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa que le apoya en la actividades agrícolas y en el ordeño de las vacas.

Carlos se dedica  a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres;  para llegar a la parcela camina 5  Km y trabajan durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en la tarde se dedica a cuidar las vacas que poseen.


	El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar una vaca que necesita para incrementar la producción de leche para la venta y obtener mejores ingresos. 

Su meta es que con los ingresos que persiva, ahorrar para  comprar un terreno para sembrar y donde tener sus animales.
texts.en: Carlos is 53 years old. He is married and he lives with his wife. He studied up to the sixth grade in school. He gets up at 5:00 am each day together with his wife who supports their agricultural activities and helps milk the cows. Carlos is a farmer, a trade that he leaned from his parents. He walks 5 kilometers to arrive at his parcel and he works in the morning while his wife works on the household chores. In the afternoon he works caring for his cows. The loan he is seeking through CREDICAMPO is to purchase a cow that he needs to increase his production of milk for sale so he can obtain higher earnings. His goal is to save the earnings to use to purchase land for planting and housing his animals.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Kadiatu from O I C Ropolo, Makeni northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with eight children. 

In 2003, Kadiau established her retail business. She began her business so that she would be able to take care of her family's welfare. She works at the business for 10 hours per day and six days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan to purchase more onions and general stock to sell. 

She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more onions and general stock to sell.

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
Isha is 35 years old and married with two children. She runs a retail shop in OIC Ropolo, northern area in Sierra Leone business. She was a house wife; she began this business to contribute to the care of the home. 

She has been in this business for the past seven years, and sells pure water, drinks, cigarettes and biscuits within her community.  She normally has good customers, and always encourages them.

Isha requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more pure water, drinks, cigarettes and biscuits to expand her business. 

She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to take care of her parent and increase her business. 

In the future, she would like her business to progress even more.

loans.use: to purchase more pure water, drinks, cigarettes and biscuits to expand her business

loans.name: Nanah

texts.en:
Meet 64-year-old Nanah from O l C Ropolo Markni, northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with eight children. 

Seven years ago, Nanah established her pharmacy business. She began her business because she wanted to create income for her survival. She works at the business from 7:00 am until 7:30 pm, 7 days per week. She says patients are always happy to come to her for treatment.

Nanah requires a loan to purchase more medical drugs to sell. 

She hopes the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Nanah plans to open a big clinic. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more medical drugs to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Emmanuel from O I C Ropolo, northern area in Sierra Leone. He is single with one child.  He has three additional dependents that live with him because they are relatives from a village.  

Emmanuel runs a general stock business; he sells soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes. He has been running this business since 2005.

He began this business to create a permanent source of income to care for his child and parent. He works at the business 12 hours per day and 6 days per week. Emmanuel says that his business is doing well, customers come to buy drinks very fast because they are always cold and he knows how to encourage them.

Emmanuel has requested a loan to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes. 

The extra income from this loan will allow him to become a successful businessman and improve his family's status of living. 

In the future, he plans to expand his business more than ever. 

He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Ibrahim from O I C, Ropolo, Makein northern area in Sierra Leone. He is married with three children between the ages of 1 and 12 years. Two of his children are currently attending school.
